intro: Cinnamomum subavenium, commonly known as the white cinnamon tree, is a species of flowering plant in the laurel family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, aromatic leaves and small, white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
